dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 1218 RH: Data Mapping to Save Moms’ Lives Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Butterfield (for himself, Mr. Bilirakis, and Ms. Blunt Rochester) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce
Additional sponsors: Ms. Moore of Wisconsin and Ms. Kelly of Illinois
Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic
For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as introduced on February 23, 2021

form.official-title: To require the Federal Communications Commission to incorporate data on maternal health outcomes into its broadband health maps.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Data Mapping to Save Moms’ Lives Act.

section.header: Mapping broadband connectivity and maternal health outcomes

subsection.header: Incorporation of maternal mortality and severe maternal morbidity data
subsection.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Federal Communications Commission shall incorporate publicly available data on maternal mortality and severe maternal morbidity, including for not less than 1 year postpartum, into the Mapping Broadband Health in America platform of the Commission.

The Federal Communications Commission shall consult with the Director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention regarding the maternal mortality and severe maternal morbidity data that should be incorporated under subsection (a).

endorsement.action-desc: Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
